intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium imbricatiforme, commonly known as the imbricate hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and produces numerous yellow flowers arranged in a composite inflorescence. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. It has hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Hieracium imbricatiforme is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in temperate climates.
